result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian R Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christian R Walker is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christian R Walker was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the sentence may be served with huber.

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is not to be around any known drug users.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Discharge Regular - 11/15/2018
of Conviction - extends probation for 6 months (02/28/2019)

1:20 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Mike Pulice present in court.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 6 months.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 1:23 p.m.
Probation review hearing on July 16, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

1:26 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Michael Pulice present in court.  Owes $176.00.  Court finds the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for one year.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the court will fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court informs defendant of the right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 1:28 p.m.
Probation review hearing on July 24, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
9:51 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites plea agreement - defendant will plea to count 1, the repeater and second & subsequent will be dismissed and count 2 will be dismissed.  State concurs.  Atty Selsing concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1.  Court strikes the enhancers.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed outright.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Selsing.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  6 months county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.  Huber if revoked.

CONDITIONS:

-court costs
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is not to be around any known drug users.

Court adjourned at 10:00 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-31-2015 09:30 am

9:16 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney John Selsing present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Selsing - has had a pretrial with the DA's office and has not received confirmation from the defendant.  Court will set for plea & sentencing on August 31, 2015 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:17 a.m.
State's
By Atty John Selsing
Status hearing at 08-03-2015 08:30 am

1:10 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty John Selsing - has been appointed by the PD's office and defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Selsing and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Selsing enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Statement by Atty Selsing in regards to bond.  Statement by the Court.  Court will set for Status Hearing on August 3, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:14 p.m.

EXCEPTION - Contact for employment purposes only.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 1:41 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has not received a copy of the complaint but reviews the DA's copy.  Clerk makes copy for the defendant.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court nots bond has been set.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant does not waive the time limits.  Court will set for Preliminary Hearing on June 23, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:44 p.m.

EXCEPTION - Contact for employment purposes only.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

EXCEPTION - Contact for employment purposes only. 1:07 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $1,000.00 signature bond and condition of:  NO Contact with Jeremy W.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  EXCEPTION - Contact for employment purposes only.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant to appear in court on June 8, 2015 at 1:30 p.m. for Initial Appearance.
